address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2016-12-16T09:44-0800. Supplementary encoding and revision by Caroline Cubé using Notetab Pro.

physdesc.extent: (17 document boxes, 36 record cartons, and 2 oversize flat boxes)

did.abstract: Materials related to the history and operations of the Bethune Theatredanse dance compnay, and its arts education program Infinite Dreams (formerly known as Dance Outreach), both founded by Zina Bethune. Includes administrative and fundraising records, clippings, photographs, and audio-visual materials documenting Bethune Theatredanse's multi-media productions as well as Dance Outreach activities.
did.physloc: Stored off-site at SRLF. Advance notice is required for access to the collection. Please contact the UCLA Library Special Collections Reference Desk for paging information.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: COLLECTION STORED OFF-SITE AT SRLF: Open for research. Advance notice required for access. Contact the UCLA Library Special Collections Reference Desk for paging information.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the physical object belong to the UCLA Library Special Collections. Literary rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: COLLECTION CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audiovisual materials in this collection will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. To review these audiovisual materials, you must notify the UCLA Library Special Collections Reference Desk in advance of your visit.
Use of electronic format material requires special equipment or further processing may be required for viewing. To review these materials you must notify the reference desk in advance of your visit.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Bethune Theatredanse Records (Collection 2304). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

acqinfo.head: Provenance/Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Sean Feeley and Ivy Bethune, 2015.

bioghist.head: Biography/History
bioghist.p: Zina Bianca Bethune was born in New York City on February 17, 1945, the daughter of Ivy (Vigder) and William Charles Bethune. She started formal ballet training at George Balanchine’s School of American Ballet at six years old. By the age of 14, Bethune was dancing with the New York City Ballet while simultaneously working as an actor, appearing in a variety of television series and movies. Alongside Harvey Keitel, she starred in Martin Scorsese’s first feature film, Who’s That Knocking at My Door, released in 1967. She also reached a wide audience via her role on the CBS TV series The Nurses from 1962-1965. Bethune continued her parallel acting and dancing careers the rest of her life, appearing in several television film and Broadway productions throughout the 1970s-1990s.

Dance became Bethune’s top priority however, and in 1979 she started Zina Bethune and Company, focusing on a traditional ballet repertoire. She moved to Los Angeles in 1979 and debuted her company as Bethune Ballet. By 1987 the company had evolved into Bethune Theatredanse, producing original multi-media performances often based on literature or film. Major productions included Mind’s Eye, Bird of Passage, Cradle of Fire, and Silent Roar.

Bethune endured a number of health problems from a young age, including scoliosis, lymphedema, and hip dysplasia. Determined to keep dancing, she underwent several surgeries and wore custom orthopedic tights the rest of her life in order to perform. Motivated by her own experience, she formed Dance Outreach, later known as Infinite Dreams, an arts education program for disabled children to learn and perform dance. Bethune and her staff taught classes and workshops throughout the Los Angeles area, and her students toured internationally and performed publicly at arts festivals and other venues, including the White House in 1989.

Zina Bethune was married to Sean Feeley for 42 years. She died in 2012 in an accident near Griffith Park in Los Angeles, when she stopped her car to help an injured animal. After her death, Infinite Dreams continued to hold classes and workshops under the name All-Abilities Dance until ceasing operations in 2015.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Materials related to the history and operations of the Bethune Theatredanse dance company, and its arts education program Infinite Dreams, formerly known as Dance Outreach, both founded by Zina Bethune. Administrative series includes business records, promotional and publicity materials, programs, artist files, performance ideas, and participation in area events and festivals. Also includes some biographical information about founder Zina Bethune. Development and fundraising includes materials related to grants, benefits, outreach, and Bethune Theatredanse's involvement in the Los Angeles Theatre Center Cooperative. Production files consist of scripts, budgets, advertising, reviews, and other materials. Clippings document the activities of Zina Bethune, Bethune Theatredanse, and Dance Outreach. Photographs and audio-visual include Zina Bethune, Bethune Theatredanse dancers and productions, and Dance Outreach students and activities.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p:
The collection is organized into the following series:
Series 1. Administrative
Series 2. Development and Fundraising
Series 3. Production Files
Series 4. Clippings
Series 5. Photographs
Series 6. Audio-Visual

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Materials related to the history and operations of Bethune Theatredanse and Dance Outreach, later known as Infinite Dreams. Includes promotional and publicity materials, programs, artist files, performance ideas, and participation in area events and festivals. Also includes some biographical information about founder Zina Bethune.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Use of electronic format material requires special equipment or further processing may be required for viewing. To review these materials you must notify the reference desk in advance of your visit.

did.unittitle: Zina Bethune - appearances and speaking engagements.
Zina Bethune and Company - promotional materials.
Los Angeles Dance Fair - registration and program.
A Very Special Arts Festival - programs, flyers.
Other festivals and appearances - programs, flyers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Documentation of fundraising efforts for Bethune Theatredanse and Dance Outreach, later known as Infinite Dreams. Includes grant applications and contracts, outreach to potential supporters, and materials related to various benefit events, particularly Dreams Come True, the annual Dance Outreach fundraiser. Also included are materials related to Bethnune Theatredanse's participation in the Los Angeles Theatre Center Cooperative in the early 1990s.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Use of electronic format material requires special equipment or further processing may be required for viewing. To review these materials you must notify the reference desk in advance of your visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Materials related to Bethune Theatredanse productions, particularly Bird of Passage and Cradle of Fire. Includes scripts, contracts, casting information, budgets and expenses, advertising, artwork, reviews, and other documentation. Also scattered materials for Galileo, Jupiter, Apollo, Silent Roar, Tipperary, and other productions.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Use of electronic format material requires special equipment or further processing may be required for viewing. To review these materials you must notify the reference desk in advance of your visit.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Newspaper clippings from a variety of Southern California sources documenting the activities of Zina Bethune, Bethune Theatredanse, and particularly Dance Outreach, later known as Infinite Dreams.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Photographs of Zina Bethune, including headshots, dance poses, and photos with celebrity friends; Bethune Theatredanse company dancers and productions; and Dance Outreach (later known as Infinite Dreams) students, classes, and events.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Primarily video footage of Bethune Theatredanse and Dance Outreach (later Infinite Dreams) productions and activities. Includes promos, performances, rehearsals, interviews, clips from television appearances, and tours. Also includes acting demos and footage for Zina Bethune and her mother, Ivy Bethune. Formats include VHS, U-Matic, Beta-SP, Mini DV, Hi-8, DVD, CD, and DAT. For a more detailed list, please consult collection folder.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: COLLECTION CONTAINS AUDIOVISUAL MATERIALS: Audiovisual materials in this collection will require assessment and possible digitization for safe access. To review these audiovisual materials, you must notify the UCLA Library Special Collections Reference Desk in advance of your visit.

did.unittitle: Infinite Dreams (formerly known as Dance Outreach).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Promos for Dance Outreach and Infinite Dreams, featuring a variety of performances including "From the Heart," "The Mike and Maty Show," "The Dance Within" and several Telethon appearances. Includes masters, raw footage, and edits.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Zina Bethune and Sarah Anderson performing "From the Heart" and "Heart Dancing." Includes footage from KCET California Stories and the NBC's Kennedy Center special.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Documentation of Dance Outreach/Infinite Dreams classes and workshops at Los Angeles area schools and other locations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Footage of Dance Outreach/Infinite Dreams performances, often featuring Zina Bethune with students, including Sarah Anderson, Russell Bartel, and Lindsay Berkovitz. Includes performances from the North Hollywood Festival, LA Open Arts, A Very Special Arts Festival, the Feather Awards, television shows, and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Performance and rehearsal footage from Infinite Dreams tours, including Italy, Japan, China, and Geneva, Switzerland.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Dance Outreach/Infinite Dreams footage from broadcast television, including excerpts from local newscasts and programs such as Great Day America and Good Day LA.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Edited and raw footage used to make promos featuring doctors interviews.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Footage from the Infinite Dreams/Dance Outreach benefits known as Friendraisers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Footage from Infinite Dreams/Dance Outreach participation in the Very Special Arts Festivals.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Footage of Infinite Dreams/Dance Outreach teachers, including some audition tapes.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: A variety of promos for Bethune Ballet and Bethune Theatredanse, many from the early 1980s and featuring Zina Bethune's celebrity friends. Includes masters as well as edited and extended versions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Short excerpts from various Bethune Theatredanse productions, including Galileo/Jupiter/Apollo, Mind's Eye, Silent Roar, Cradle of Fire, and American in Paris. Some tapes include Infinite Dreams/Dance Outreach footage as well.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Master videotape and 16mm film of early Bethune Ballet performances. One marked Internal Footage from first Bethune Ballet performance at Embassy Theatre. 16mm film is "The American" and "The Collector."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Rehearsal and performance footage. Includes masters, multiple camera angles, and music.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Footage of early Bethune Ballet/Bethune Theatredanse performances, including Romeo & Juliet, The Trial of St. Joan, Don Quixote, Leibesleider Walzer, Somewhere in Time, and Bird of Passage.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Footage of Bethune Theatredanse original production that tells the story of two teenagers, one living in Nazi Germany and the other on the streets of 1990s Los Angeles. Includes promos, excerpts, and masters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Footage of Bethune Theatredanse adaptation of Ray Bradbury's short story about a planet where a human's lifespan is only eight days. Includes promos, scene excerpts, rehearsals, and full performances from multiple camera angles. CD/DVD copies are in Box 60.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Footage of Bethune Theatredanse's multimedia exploration into science fiction and technology, inspired by John Wehrle's Los Angeles mural of the same name. Includes audio files, music, excerpts, and performances for LA Open Arts, Dance Roots, and others.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Footage of Bethune Theatredanse's multimedia exploration of Shamanism in the past, present, and future. Primarily multiple camera footage of original performances at Los Angeles Contemporary Exhibitions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Footage of Bethune Theatredanse's production based on the C.S. Lewis science fiction story Perelandra. Includes promos, raw footage, and performances.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Footage of Bethune Theatredanse multimedia production based on the journey of a gray whale. Includes promos, multiple camera angles, and masters.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Reel-to-reels, 45rpm discs, and a cassette, mostly unidentified but may contain music for older productions.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Footage of Zina Bethune. Includes acting demo as well as copies of her performances in Who's That Knocking at My Door, and a variety of TV shows throughout the 1960s-1980s. Also includes the 1957 broadcast of The Nutcracker, in which she played the part of Clara; documentation of her efforts to walk after surgery; and appearances in interviews and award shows.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Names include Gene Bua, Twyla Tharp, Morawski, Randy Allaire, Ann Marie Melendez, Karina del Mar, Janice Cronkhite, Jina, Stephanie Lightburn, Marnie Baker, Leyda Sol Garcia, Lisa Street, Charles David Anderson, Lisa Goldin, Natalie Bowers, Amelia Kinkade, Michael Massucci, and 3 Hip Hop dancers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Promotional material from Wheels for Humanity, Lymphatic Research Foundation, Youth Leadership Forum, Rife Technology, and Tod Hillman-Strong Productions. Performances by Tobinworld, LA Chamber Ballet, and Heidelberger Ballet.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: 5 tapes featuring interviews with Zina Bethune and Dr. Charles Engh.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Demo reels and copies of Ivy Bethune's various TV appearances.
